data.title: Harry Towb: actor
data.meta_description: Asked, once, why he had become an actor, Harry Towb said it was because he had always wanted to be someone else. The comment suggested that he was his own fiercest critic — which was true up to a
data.text:
Asked, once, why he had become an actor, Harry Towb said it was because he had always wanted to be someone else. The comment suggested that he was his own fiercest critic — which was true up to a point. But what turned him towards the theatre was not so much dissatisfaction with himself as being fascinated by others, a quality that made him one of the finest character actors of his day. Towb, said one critic, “can be relied upon to add distinction to any production”.

He was born in 1925 in Larne, Co Antrim, into, as he put it, the “minority of all minorities”, the Jewish community of Northern Ireland. His father was a Russian ?migr? who had gone to America via England
